title: California Air Quality Worsens as Wildfire Smoke Spreads
description: Air quality levels across California are declining due to wildfire smoke and pollution. Check current alerts, health risks, and safety tips.

pages.title: Air Quality Alerts Issued in California
pages.description: Several parts of the state are reporting moderate to unhealthy air quality levels today.

pages.title: Smoke and Pollution Driving AQI Higher
pages.description: Wildfire smoke, trapped weather conditions, and urban emissions are pushing pollution levels up.

pages.title: Wildfire Smoke Reaches Major Cities
pages.description: Los Angeles, the Bay Area, and Central California are seeing rising PM2.5 pollution from smoke.

pages.title: Urban and Valley Regions Hit Hardest
pages.description: Cities and low-lying areas are experiencing reduced visibility and unhealthy air conditions.

pages.title: Poor Air Can Affect Your Health
pages.description: Breathing issues, coughing, eye irritation, and fatigue are common during poor air quality days.

pages.title: Sensitive Groups Urged to Be Careful
pages.description: Children, older adults, and people with asthma or heart disease face higher health risks.

pages.title: How to Protect Yourself
pages.description: Stay indoors, keep windows closed, wear an N95 mask outdoors, and limit physical activity.

pages.title: Stay Alert as Air Quality Changes
pages.description: Conditions may improve with weather changes, but wildfire smoke remains a concern.

pages.title: Stay Updated
pages.description: Use trusted air quality apps and official alerts to track AQI levels in your area.
